title: OIDC keycloak dev service (ui) is not taking devRootAppend into account
body:
### Describe the bug

When using the great dev ui for the OIDC extension in combination with the `quarkus.http.non-application-root-path` setting, the redirect URIs for the login and logout link are incorrectly pointing towards the hard-coded `/q/dev` path.

In the dev-template, the redirect URI is hard coded in multiple locations, e.g. https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/main/extensions/oidc/deployment/src/main/resources/dev-templates/provider.html#L84

I tried replacing the ocurrences it with `{devRootAppend}`. This works, but is not clean since the address should be URL encoded. Something like `encodeURI({devRootAppend})` would be needed.

### Expected behavior

When setting `quarkus.http.non-application-root-path`, the keycloak dev service should redirect towards the dev UI after performing a login / logout.

### Actual behavior

When setting `quarkus.http.non-application-root-path`, the keycloak dev service redirects to a non-existent page after logging in via the dev UI.

### How to Reproduce?

1. Create a new quarkus application with oidc extension.
2. Set `quarkus.http.non-application-root-path=/`
3. Open http://localhost:8080/dev/io.quarkus.quarkus-oidc/provider
4. Login as alice
